		<div id="siteNotice" class="mw-body-content"><div id="centralNotice"></div><!-- CentralNotice --></div>
	<div class="mw-indicators mw-body-content">
</div>

	<h1 id="firstHeading" class="firstHeading" lang="en">Lithuanian Civil War (1432–1438)</h1>

	<div id="bodyContent" class="mw-body-content">
		<div id="siteSub" class="noprint">From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia</div>
		<div id="contentSub"></div>


		<div id="jump-to-nav"></div>
		<a class="mw-jump-link" href="#mw-head">Jump to navigation</a>
		<a class="mw-jump-link" href="#p-search">Jump to search</a>
		<div id="mw-content-text" dir="ltr" class="mw-content-ltr" lang="en"><div class="mw-parser-output"><style data-mw-deduplicate="TemplateStyles:r904532608">@media all and (min-width:720px){.mw-parser-output .desktop-float-right{box-sizing:border-box;float:right;clear:right}}</style><table class="infobox vevent" style="width:25.5em;border-spacing:2px;"><tbody><tr><th decoding="async" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/0a/Vilkamir_battle_monument_%E2%80%94_%D0%9F%D0%BE%D0%BC%D0%BD%D1%96%D0%BA_%D0%B1%D1%96%D1%82%D0%B2%D1%8B_%D0%BF%D0%B0%D0%B4_%D0%92%D1%96%D0%BB%D1%8C%D0%BA%D0%B0%D0%BC%D1%96%D1%80%D0%B0%D0%BC.Jpg/450px-Vilkamir_battle_monument_%E2%80%94_%D0%9F%D0%BE%D0%BC%D0%BD%D1%96%D0%BA_%D0%B1%D1%96%D1%82%D0%B2%D1%8B_%D0%BF%D0%B0%D0%B4_%D0%92%D1%96%D0%BB%D1%8C%D0%BA%D0%B0%D0%BC%D1%96%D1%80%D0%B0%D0%BC.Jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/0a/Vilkamir_battle_monument_%E2%80%94_%D0%9F%D0%BE%D0%BC%D0%BD%D1%96%D0%BA_%D0%B1%D1%96%D1%82%D0%B2%D1%8B_%D0%BF%D0%B0%D0%B4_%D0%92%D1%96%D0%BB%D1%8C%D0%BA%D0%B0%D0%BC%D1%96%D1%80%D0%B0%D0%BC.Jpg/600px-Vilkamir_battle_monument_%E2%80%94_%D0%9F%D0%BE%D0%BC%D0%BD%D1%96%D0%BA_%D0%B1%D1%96%D1%82%D0%B2%D1%8B_%D0%BF%D0%B0%D0%B4_%D0%92%D1%96%D0%BB%D1%8C%D0%BA%D0%B0%D0%BC%D1%96%D1%80%D0%B0%D0%BC.Jpg 2x" data-file-width="1224" data-file-height="1632" width="300" height="400"></a><br>Monument at the field of the <a href="/wiki/Battle_of_Pabaiskas" class="mw-redirect" title="Battle of Pabaiskas">Battle of Pabaiskas</a></td></tr><tr><td colspan="2"><table style="width:100%;margin:0;padding:0;border:0"><tbody><tr><th style="padding-right:1em">Date</th><td>August 1432 – 1438</td></tr><tr><th style="padding-right:1em">Location</th><td><div class="location"><a href="/wiki/Grand_Duchy_of_Lithuania" title="Grand Duchy of Lithuania">Grand Duchy of Lithuania</a></div></td></tr><tr><th style="padding-right:1em">Result</th><td>
Švitrigaila defeat</td></tr></tbody></table></td></tr><tr><th colspan="2" style="background-color:#C3D6EF;text-align:center;vertical-align:middle;font-size:110%;">Belligerents</th></tr><tr><td style="width:50%;border-right:1px dotted #aaa;">
<p><a href="/wiki/File:POL_COA_Pogo%C5%84_Ruska.svg" class="image"><img alt="POL COA Pogoń Ruska.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/44/POL_COA_Pogo%C5%84_Ruska.svg/18px-POL_COA_Pogo%C5%84_Ruska.svg.png" decoding="async" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/44/POL_COA_Pogo%C5%84_Ruska.svg/27px-POL_COA_Pogo%C5%84_Ruska.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/44/POL_COA_Pogo%C5%84_Ruska.svg/36px-POL_COA_Pogo%C5%84_Ruska.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="799" data-file-height="843" width="18" height="19"></a> <a href="https://uk.wikipedia.org/wiki/%D0%92%D0%B5%D0%BB%D0%B8%D0%BA%D0%B5_%D0%BA%D0%BD%D1%8F%D0%B7%D1%96%D0%B2%D1%81%D1%82%D0%B2%D0%BE_%D0%A0%D1%83%D1%81%D1%8C%D0%BA%D0%B5_(1432%E2%80%941435)" class="extiw" title="uk:Велике князівство Руське (1432—1435)">Grand Duchy of Rusʹ</a> (Švitrigaila supporters) <br>
<span class="flagicon"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/2d/Flag_of_the_State_of_the_Teutonic_Order.svg/23px-Flag_of_the_State_of_the_Teutonic_Order.svg.png" decoding="async" class="thumbborder" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/2d/Flag_of_the_State_of_the_Teutonic_Order.svg/35px-Flag_of_the_State_of_the_Teutonic_Order.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/2d/Flag_of_the_State_of_the_Teutonic_Order.svg/46px-Flag_of_the_State_of_the_Teutonic_Order.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="640" data-file-height="400" width="23" height="14"></span> <a href="/wiki/Teutonic_Order" title="Teutonic Order">Teutonic Order</a>
</p>
<hr>
<p><span class="flagicon"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/2d/Flag_of_the_State_of_the_Teutonic_Order.svg/23px-Flag_of_the_State_of_the_Teutonic_Order.svg.png" decoding="async" class="thumbborder" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/2d/Flag_of_the_State_of_the_Teutonic_Order.svg/35px-Flag_of_the_State_of_the_Teutonic_Order.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/2d/Flag_of_the_State_of_the_Teutonic_Order.svg/46px-Flag_of_the_State_of_the_Teutonic_Order.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="640" data-file-height="400" width="23" height="14"></span> <a href="/wiki/Livonian_Order" title="Livonian Order">Livonian Order</a> <br>
<span class="flagicon"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/f7/Golden_Horde_flag_1339.svg/23px-Golden_Horde_flag_1339.svg.png" decoding="async" class="thumbborder" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/f7/Golden_Horde_flag_1339.svg/35px-Golden_Horde_flag_1339.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/f7/Golden_Horde_flag_1339.svg/45px-Golden_Horde_flag_1339.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="300" data-file-height="200" width="23" height="15"></span> <a href="/wiki/Golden_Horde" title="Golden Horde">Golden Horde</a> <br>
<span class="flagicon"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/59/Flag_of_Moldavia.svg/23px-Flag_of_Moldavia.svg.png" decoding="async" class="thumbborder" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/59/Flag_of_Moldavia.svg/35px-Flag_of_Moldavia.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/59/Flag_of_Moldavia.svg/45px-Flag_of_Moldavia.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="600" data-file-height="400" width="23" height="15"></span> <a href="/wiki/Principality_of_Moldavia" class="mw-redirect" title="Principality of Moldavia">Principality of Moldavia</a>
</p>
<hr>
<span class="flagicon"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b4/Husitsk%C3%A1_korouhev.png/20px-Husitsk%C3%A1_korouhev.png" decoding="async" class="thumbborder" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b4/Husitsk%C3%A1_korouhev.png/31px-Husitsk%C3%A1_korouhev.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b4/Husitsk%C3%A1_korouhev.png/40px-Husitsk%C3%A1_korouhev.png 2x" data-file-width="472" data-file-height="354" width="20" height="15"></span> <a href="/wiki/Hussite" class="mw-redirect" title="Hussite">Hussites</a></td><td style="width:50%;padding-left:0.25em">
<p><a href="/wiki/File:Herb_Pogon_Litewska.jpg" class="image"><img alt="Herb Pogon Litewska.jpg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/02/Herb_Pogon_Litewska.jpg/18px-Herb_Pogon_Litewska.jpg" decoding="async" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/02/Herb_Pogon_Litewska.jpg/27px-Herb_Pogon_Litewska.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/02/Herb_Pogon_Litewska.jpg/36px-Herb_Pogon_Litewska.jpg 2x" data-file-width="430" data-file-height="444" width="18" height="19"></a> <a href="/wiki/Grand_Duchy_of_Lithuania" title="Grand Duchy of Lithuania">Grand Duchy of Lithuania</a> (Sigismund supporters) <br>
<span class="flagicon"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/7c/Kingdom_of_Poland-flag.svg/20px-Kingdom_of_Poland-flag.svg.png" decoding="async" class="thumbborder" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/7c/Kingdom_of_Poland-flag.svg/31px-Kingdom_of_Poland-flag.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/7c/Kingdom_of_Poland-flag.svg/40px-Kingdom_of_Poland-flag.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="319" data-file-height="239" width="20" height="15"></span> <a href="/wiki/Kingdom_of_Poland_(1385%E2%80%931569)" title="Kingdom of Poland (1385–1569)">Kingdom of Poland</a>
</p>
<hr>
<span class="flagicon"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/8b/Hussite_banner_%28Orphans%29.png/19px-Hussite_banner_%28Orphans%29.png" decoding="async" class="thumbborder" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/8b/Hussite_banner_%28Orphans%29.png/29px-Hussite_banner_%28Orphans%29.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/8b/Hussite_banner_%28Orphans%29.png/38px-Hussite_banner_%28Orphans%29.png 2x" data-file-width="1000" data-file-height="791" width="19" height="15"></span> <a href="/wiki/Sirotci" title="Sirotci">Orphans</a> (<a href="/wiki/Hussite" class="mw-redirect" title="Hussite">Hussite</a> mercenaries)</td></tr><tr><th colspan="2" style="background-color:#C3D6EF;text-align:center;vertical-align:middle;font-size:110%;">Commanders and leaders</th></tr><tr><td style="width:50%;border-right:1px dotted #aaa;">
<a href="/wiki/%C5%A0vitrigaila" title="Švitrigaila">Švitrigaila</a> <br> <a href="/wiki/Sigismund_Korybut" title="Sigismund Korybut">Sigismund Korybut</a>&nbsp;<a href="/wiki/Killed_in_action" title="Killed in action"><span style="font-family:'Times New Roman','Old English Text MT',serif"><b>†</b></span></a> <br> <span class="flagicon"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/0c/Grunwald_Wielki_Mistrz1.svg/19px-Grunwald_Wielki_Mistrz1.svg.png" decoding="async" class="thumbborder" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/0c/Grunwald_Wielki_Mistrz1.svg/29px-Grunwald_Wielki_Mistrz1.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/0c/Grunwald_Wielki_Mistrz1.svg/38px-Grunwald_Wielki_Mistrz1.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="650" data-file-height="514" width="19" height="15"></span> <a href="/wiki/Paul_von_Rusdorf" title="Paul von Rusdorf">Paul von Rusdorf</a> <br> <a href="/w/index.php?title=Franco_Kerskorff&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Franco Kerskorff (page does not exist)">Franco Kerskorff</a>&nbsp;<a href="/wiki/Killed_in_action" title="Killed in action"><span style="font-family:'Times New Roman','Old English Text MT',serif"><b>†</b></span></a></td><td style="width:50%;padding-left:0.25em">
<a href="/wiki/Sigismund_K%C4%99stutaitis" title="Sigismund Kęstutaitis">Sigismund Kęstutaitis</a> <br> <a href="/wiki/Michael_%C5%BDygimantaitis" title="Michael Žygimantaitis">Michael Žygimantaitis</a> <br> <a href="/wiki/Jogaila" class="mw-redirect" title="Jogaila">Jogaila</a> <br> <span class="flagicon"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/8b/Hussite_banner_%28Orphans%29.png/19px-Hussite_banner_%28Orphans%29.png" decoding="async" class="thumbborder" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/8b/Hussite_banner_%28Orphans%29.png/29px-Hussite_banner_%28Orphans%29.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/8b/Hussite_banner_%28Orphans%29.png/38px-Hussite_banner_%28Orphans%29.png 2x" data-file-width="1000" data-file-height="791" width="19" height="15"></span> <a href="/wiki/Jan_%C4%8Capek_ze_S%C3%A1n" title="Jan Čapek ze Sán">Jan Čapek ze Sán</a></td></tr></tbody></table>
<div role="navigation" class="navbox" aria-labelledby="Lithuanian_Civil_War_of_1432–1438" style="margin:0;float:right;clear:right;width:25.5em;margin-bottom:0.5em;margin-left:1em;;padding:3px"><table class="nowraplinks navbox-vertical mw-collapsible autocollapse navbox-inner mw-made-collapsible mw-collapsed" style="border-spacing:0;background:transparent;color:inherit"><tbody><tr><th scope="col" class="navbox-title" colspan="2" style="background-color:#C3D6EF;"><span class="mw-collapsible-toggle mw-collapsible-toggle-default mw-collapsible-toggle-collapsed" role="button" tabindex="0" aria-expanded="false"><a class="mw-collapsible-text">show</a></span><div class="plainlinks hlist navbar mini"><ul><li class="nv-view"><a href="/wiki/Template:Campaignbox_Lithuanian_Civil_War_of_1432%E2%80%931438" title="Template:Campaignbox Lithuanian Civil War of 1432–1438"><abbr title="View this template" style=";background-color:#C3D6EF;;background:none transparent;border:none;-moz-box-shadow:none;-webkit-box-shadow:none;box-shadow:none; padding:0;">v</abbr></a></li><li class="nv-talk"><a href="/wiki/Template_talk:Campaignbox_Lithuanian_Civil_War_of_1432%E2%80%931438" title="Template talk:Campaignbox Lithuanian Civil War of 1432–1438"><abbr title="Discuss this template" style=";background-color:#C3D6EF;;background:none transparent;border:none;-moz-box-shadow:none;-webkit-box-shadow:none;box-shadow:none; padding:0;">t</abbr></a></li><li class="nv-edit"><a class="external text" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template:Campaignbox_Lithuanian_Civil_War_of_1432%E2%80%931438&amp;action=edit"><abbr title="Edit this template" style=";background-color:#C3D6EF;;background:none transparent;border:none;-moz-box-shadow:none;-webkit-box-shadow:none;box-shadow:none; padding:0;">e</abbr></a></li></ul></div><div id="Lithuanian_Civil_War_of_1432–1438" style="font-size:114%;margin:0 4em"><span style="line-height:1.6em"><a class="mw-selflink selflink"><span class="wrap">Lithuanian Civil War of 1432–1438</span></a></span></div></th></tr><tr style="display: none;"><td colspan="2" class="navbox-list navbox-odd hlist" style="width:100%;padding:0px"><div style="padding:0em 0.25em">
<ul><li><a href="/wiki/Battle_of_A%C5%A1mena" class="mw-redirect" title="Battle of Ašmena">Ašmena</a></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Battle_of_Wilkomierz" title="Battle of Wilkomierz">Pabaiskas</a></li></ul>
</div></td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<p>The <b>Lithuanian Civil War of 1432–1438</b><sup id="cite_ref-polekh_1-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-polekh-1">[1]</a></sup> was a conflict over the succession to the throne of the <a href="/wiki/Grand_Duchy_of_Lithuania" title="Grand Duchy of Lithuania">Grand Duchy of Lithuania</a>, after <a href="/wiki/Vytautas_the_Great" class="mw-redirect" title="Vytautas the Great">Vytautas the Great</a> died in 1430 without leaving an heir.<sup id="cite_ref-rowell_2-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-rowell-2">[2]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-vauch_3-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-vauch-3">[3]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-green_4-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-green-4">[4]</a></sup>  The war was fought on the one side by <a href="/wiki/%C5%A0vitrigaila" title="Švitrigaila">Švitrigaila</a>, allied with the <a href="/wiki/Teutonic_Knights" class="mw-redirect" title="Teutonic Knights">Teutonic Knights</a>, and on the other by <a href="/wiki/Sigismund_K%C4%99stutaitis" title="Sigismund Kęstutaitis">Sigismund Kęstutaitis</a>, backed by the <a href="/wiki/Kingdom_of_Poland_(1385%E2%80%931569)" title="Kingdom of Poland (1385–1569)">Kingdom of Poland</a>. The war threatened to sever the <a href="/wiki/Union_of_Krewo" title="Union of Krewo">Union of Krewo</a>, the <a href="/wiki/Personal_union" title="Personal union">personal union</a> between Poland and Lithuania.<sup id="cite_ref-rowell_2-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-rowell-2">[2]</a></sup> Švitrigaila's alliance with the <a href="/wiki/Grand_Master_of_the_Teutonic_Order" title="Grand Master of the Teutonic Order">Grand Master of the Teutonic Order</a>, <a href="/wiki/Paul_von_Rusdorf" title="Paul von Rusdorf">Paul von Rusdorf</a>, launched the <a href="/wiki/Polish%E2%80%93Teutonic_War_(1431%E2%80%931435)" title="Polish–Teutonic War (1431–1435)">Polish–Teutonic War (1431–1435)</a> but failed to secure victory for Švitrigaila.<sup id="cite_ref-eric_5-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-eric-5">[5]</a></sup>
</p><p>When Sigismund captured power in Lithuania by staging a coup in 1432, Lithuania split into two opposing camps, and there began three years of devastating hostilities. To prevent the Knights from continuing their support of Švitrigaila, Poland backed a <a href="/wiki/Hussite" class="mw-redirect" title="Hussite">Hussite</a> invasion of <a href="/wiki/Prussia_(region)" title="Prussia (region)">Prussia</a> in 1433.<sup id="cite_ref-u306_6-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-u306-6">[6]</a></sup> The war ended in a decisive defeat for Švitrigaila and his ally, the <a href="/wiki/Livonian_Order" title="Livonian Order">Livonian branch of the Teutonic Knights</a>, at the <a href="/wiki/Battle_of_Pabaiskas" class="mw-redirect" title="Battle of Pabaiskas">Battle of Pabaiskas</a> in September 1435. Švitrigaila eventually surrendered in 1437; Sigismund Kęstutaitis ruled Lithuania for only eight years before he was assassinated in 1440.
</p>
<div id="toc" class="toc" role="navigation" aria-labelledby="mw-toc-heading"><input type="checkbox" role="button" id="toctogglecheckbox" class="toctogglecheckbox" style="display:none"><div class="toctitle" dir="ltr" lang="en"><h2 id="mw-toc-heading">Contents</h2><span class="toctogglespan"><label class="toctogglelabel" for="toctogglecheckbox"></label></span></div>

<li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-8"><a href="#References"><span class="tocnumber">8</span> <span class="toctext">References</span></a></li>
<li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-9"><a href="#Further_reading"><span class="tocnumber">9</span> <span class="toctext">Further reading</span></a></li>
</ul>
</div>

<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Prelude">Prelude</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Lithuanian_Civil_War_(1432%E2%80%931438)&amp;action=edit&amp;section=1" title="Edit section: Prelude">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">See also: <a href="/wiki/Lithuanian_Civil_War_(1381%E2%80%931384)" title="Lithuanian Civil War (1381–1384)">Lithuanian Civil War (1381–1384)</a>, <a href="/wiki/Lithuanian_Civil_War_(1389%E2%80%931392)" title="Lithuanian Civil War (1389–1392)">Lithuanian Civil War (1389–1392)</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Andrei_of_Polotsk" title="Andrei of Polotsk">Andrei of Polotsk</a></div>
<p>The Grand Duchy of Lithuania and the Kingdom of Poland had created several tenuous unions in the decades preceding the conflict, including the 1385 <a href="/wiki/Union_of_Krewo" title="Union of Krewo">Union of Krewo</a>, the 1392 <a href="/wiki/Ostr%C3%B3w_Agreement" title="Ostrów Agreement">Ostrów Agreement</a>, and the 1413 <a href="/wiki/Union_of_Horod%C5%82o" title="Union of Horodło">Union of Horodło</a>. The two states had successfully joined forces against a common enemy, the <a href="/wiki/Teutonic_Knights" class="mw-redirect" title="Teutonic Knights">Teutonic Knights</a>, at the 1410 <a href="/wiki/Battle_of_Grunwald" title="Battle of Grunwald">Battle of Grunwald</a>. The Knights' defeat in the battle weakened but did not completely vanquish their military power and they continued to engage in lesser conflicts.<sup id="cite_ref-france_7-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-france-7">[7]</a></sup> Internal tensions within the tentatively unified state persisted after the battle. While Jogaila (Jagiełło) and Vytautas had converted to <a href="/wiki/Roman_Catholicism" class="mw-redirect" title="Roman Catholicism">Roman Catholicism</a>, the <a href="/wiki/Eastern_Orthodox" class="mw-redirect" title="Eastern Orthodox">Eastern Orthodox</a> elite, along with some Lithuanian magnates, opposed a closer union with Poland.<sup class="noprint Inline-Template Template-Fact" style="white-space:nowrap;">[<i><a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Citation_needed" title="Wikipedia:Citation needed"><span title="This claim needs references to reliable sources. (December 2016)">citation needed</span></a></i>]</sup>
</p><p>On 27 October 1430 <a href="/wiki/Vytautas_the_Great" class="mw-redirect" title="Vytautas the Great">Vytautas the Great</a>, <a href="/wiki/Grand_Duke_of_Lithuania" class="mw-redirect" title="Grand Duke of Lithuania">Grand Duke of Lithuania</a>, suddenly died without leaving an heir or a will. His coronation as <a href="/wiki/King_of_Lithuania" class="mw-redirect" title="King of Lithuania">King of Lithuania</a> had been scheduled for September 1430, but the Poles had prevented the crown from reaching Lithuania.<sup id="cite_ref-koncius_8-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-koncius-8">[8]</a></sup> Vytautas' only daughter, <a href="/wiki/Sophia_of_Lithuania" title="Sophia of Lithuania">Sophia of Lithuania</a>, had married <a href="/wiki/Vasily_I_of_Moscow" title="Vasily I of Moscow">Vasily I of Moscow</a> and had only one surviving son, <a href="/wiki/Vasily_II_of_Moscow" title="Vasily II of Moscow">Vasily II</a>. He was <a href="/wiki/Eastern_Christianity" title="Eastern Christianity">Orthodox</a> and could not lead the <a href="/wiki/Christianization_of_Lithuania" title="Christianization of Lithuania">recently Christianized</a> Catholic Grand Duchy.<sup id="cite_ref-kiaupa_9-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-kiaupa-9">[9]</a></sup> Their adherence to the Orthodox faith also prevented many other <a href="/wiki/Gediminids" title="Gediminids">Gediminids</a> from becoming pretenders to the throne. There were two most suitable Catholic candidates: Vytautas' brother and legal heir, <a href="/wiki/Sigismund_K%C4%99stutaitis" title="Sigismund Kęstutaitis">Sigismund Kęstutaitis</a>, and Vytautas' cousin <a href="/wiki/%C5%A0vitrigaila" title="Švitrigaila">Švitrigaila</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-kiaupa_9-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-kiaupa-9">[9]</a></sup>
</p><p>The <a href="/wiki/Lithuanian_nobility" title="Lithuanian nobility">Lithuanian nobles</a> unilaterally elected Švitrigaila as the new Grand Duke.<sup id="cite_ref-kiaupa_9-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-kiaupa-9">[9]</a></sup> This violated the terms of the Union of Horodło of 1413, wherein the Lithuanians had pledged not to elect a new Grand Duke without the approval of the <a href="/wiki/Kingdom_of_Poland_(1385%E2%80%931569)" title="Kingdom of Poland (1385–1569)">Kingdom of Poland</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-kiaupa_9-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-kiaupa-9">[9]</a></sup> At the time <a href="/wiki/Jogaila_(Jagie%C5%82%C5%82o)" class="mw-redirect" title="Jogaila (Jagiełło)">Jogaila (Jagiełło)</a>, <a href="/wiki/King_of_Poland" class="mw-redirect" title="King of Poland">King of Poland</a> and brother of Švitrigaila, was in Lithuania and participated in the funeral of Vytautas. On 7 November 1430, he announced that he approved the election and that Polish–Lithuanian relationship would be formally determined on 15 August 1431.<sup id="cite_ref-petra_10-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-petra-10">[10]</a></sup> However, an armed conflict erupted due to territorial disputes in <a href="/wiki/Podolia" title="Podolia">Podolia</a> and <a href="/wiki/Volhynia" title="Volhynia">Volhynia</a>, which, according to the understanding of the Polish nobility, under the terms of a 1411 agreement, were to have been ruled by Lithuania only during the lifetime of Vytautas.<sup id="cite_ref-kiaupa_9-4" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-kiaupa-9">[9]</a></sup>
</p>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Lutsk_War">Lutsk War</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Lithuanian_Civil_War_(1432%E2%80%931438)&amp;action=edit&amp;section=2" title="Edit section: Lutsk War">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">See also: <a href="/wiki/Polish%E2%80%93Teutonic_War_(1431%E2%80%9335)" class="mw-redirect" title="Polish–Teutonic War (1431–35)">Polish–Teutonic War (1431–35)</a></div>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Lithuanian_Grand_Duke_%C5%A0vitrigaila.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/e3/Lithuanian_Grand_Duke_%C5%A0vitrigaila.jpg/220px-Lithuanian_Grand_Duke_%C5%A0vitrigaila.jpg" decoding="async" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/e3/Lithuanian_Grand_Duke_%C5%A0vitrigaila.jpg/330px-Lithuanian_Grand_Duke_%C5%A0vitrigaila.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/e3/Lithuanian_Grand_Duke_%C5%A0vitrigaila.jpg/440px-Lithuanian_Grand_Duke_%C5%A0vitrigaila.jpg 2x" data-file-width="468" data-file-height="451" width="220" height="212"></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Lithuanian_Grand_Duke_%C5%A0vitrigaila.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>Švitrigaila as portrayed by <a href="/wiki/Alexander_Guagnini" title="Alexander Guagnini">Alexander Guagnini</a></div></div></div>
<p>When Polish troops invaded <a href="/wiki/Podolia" title="Podolia">Podolia</a>, Švitrigaila arrested his brother <a href="/wiki/Jogaila" class="mw-redirect" title="Jogaila">Jogaila</a>, King of Poland, in Vilnius.<sup id="cite_ref-jucas_11-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-jucas-11">[11]</a></sup> Jogaila was released when he promised to return Podolia to the Grand Duchy of Lithuania. The <a href="/wiki/Szlachta" title="Szlachta">Polish nobility</a>, led by <a href="/wiki/Zbigniew_Ole%C5%9Bnicki_(cardinal)" title="Zbigniew Oleśnicki (cardinal)">Zbigniew Oleśnicki</a>, gathered in <a href="/wiki/Sandomierz" title="Sandomierz">Sandomierz</a> in February 1431.<sup id="cite_ref-jucas_11-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-jucas-11">[11]</a></sup> Outraged, they voided the King's promises and demanded that Švitrigaila acknowledge his <a href="/wiki/Fealty" title="Fealty">fealty</a> to Jogaila.<sup id="cite_ref-kiaupa_9-5" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-kiaupa-9">[9]</a></sup> Švitrigaila refused, professed full independence, and even asked <a href="/wiki/Sigismund,_Holy_Roman_Emperor" title="Sigismund, Holy Roman Emperor">Holy Roman Emperor Sigismund</a> to send him the crown that had been intended for Vytautas.<sup id="cite_ref-NCMH_12-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-NCMH-12">[12]</a></sup> In the same letter, Švitrigaila promised his loyalty to Sigismund and discussed a possible marriage to a daughter of <a href="/wiki/Voivode_of_Moldavia" class="mw-redirect" title="Voivode of Moldavia">Voivode of Moldavia</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-petra_10-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-petra-10">[10]</a></sup>
</p><p>Švitrigaila began organizing a wider anti-Polish coalition.<sup id="cite_ref-els_13-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-els-13">[13]</a></sup> He negotiated with the <a href="/wiki/Teutonic_Knights" class="mw-redirect" title="Teutonic Knights">Teutonic Knights</a>, with <a href="/wiki/Sigismund,_Holy_Roman_Emperor" title="Sigismund, Holy Roman Emperor">Holy Roman Emperor Sigismund</a>, with <a href="/wiki/Moldavia" title="Moldavia">Moldavia</a>, with the <a href="/wiki/Golden_Horde" title="Golden Horde">Golden Horde</a>, and with the dukes of the eastern lands of the <a href="/wiki/Grand_Duchy_of_Lithuania" title="Grand Duchy of Lithuania">Grand Duchy of Lithuania</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-kiaupa_9-6" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-kiaupa-9">[9]</a></sup> The most promising prospect as an ally was the <a href="/wiki/Teutonic_Order" title="Teutonic Order">Teutonic Order</a>, which was seeking to undo the <a href="/wiki/Polish%E2%80%93Lithuanian_union" title="Polish–Lithuanian union">Polish–Lithuanian union</a> that had led to the Order's defeat at the <a href="/wiki/Battle_of_Grunwald" title="Battle of Grunwald">Battle of Grunwald</a> (1410).<sup id="cite_ref-u306_6-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-u306-6">[6]</a></sup> In June 1431 the Teutonic Knights and Švitrigaila signed the <a href="/wiki/Treaty_of_Christmemel" title="Treaty of Christmemel">Treaty of Christmemel</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-kiaupa_9-7" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-kiaupa-9">[9]</a></sup> Švitrigaila's cause was also aided by <a href="/wiki/Moldavia" title="Moldavia">Moldavian</a> forces led by <a href="/wiki/Alexander_the_Good" class="mw-redirect" title="Alexander the Good">Alexander the Good</a>, who attacked Poland in the southeast.<sup id="cite_ref-els_13-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-els-13">[13]</a></sup>
</p><p>On 25 June 1431, the Polish army invaded <a href="/wiki/Volhynia" title="Volhynia">Volhynia</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-jucas_11-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-jucas-11">[11]</a></sup> They captured part of Volhynia, <a href="/wiki/Horod%C5%82o" title="Horodło">Horodło</a>, <a href="/wiki/Volodymyr-Volynskyi" title="Volodymyr-Volynskyi">Volodymyr-Volynskyi</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Zbarazh" title="Zbarazh">Zbarazh</a>, and defeated Švitrigaila's men near <a href="/wiki/Lutsk" title="Lutsk">Lutsk</a>. However, the Poles did not succeed in capturing <a href="/wiki/Lubart%27s_Castle" title="Lubart's Castle">Lubart's Castle</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-jucas_11-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-jucas-11">[11]</a></sup> At the same time, pursuant to the Treaty of Christmemel, the Teutonic Knights declared war and invaded Poland.<sup id="cite_ref-NCMH_12-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-NCMH-12">[12]</a></sup> Finding little opposition, the Knights ravaged <a href="/wiki/Dobrzy%C5%84_Land" title="Dobrzyń Land">Dobrzyń Land</a>, taking the town of <a href="/wiki/Nieszawa" title="Nieszawa">Nieszawa</a>, and tried to move on to the <a href="/wiki/Kuyavia" title="Kuyavia">Kuyavia</a> and <a href="/wiki/Krajna" title="Krajna">Krajna</a> regions. However, the Teutonic army was defeated on 13 September 1431 <a href="/w/index.php?title=Battle_of_D%C4%85bki&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Battle of Dąbki (page does not exist)">at Dąbki</a>, near <a href="/wiki/Nak%C5%82o_nad_Noteci%C4%85" title="Nakło nad Notecią">Nakel</a> (now Nakło nad Notecią).<sup id="cite_ref-biskup_14-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-biskup-14">[14]</a></sup> Švitrigaila, who was besieged in the Lubart's Castle, offered to negotiate peace on 20 August.<sup id="cite_ref-jucas_11-4" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-jucas-11">[11]</a></sup> An agreement was reached on 26 August, thus ending the so-called Lutsk War.<sup id="cite_ref-jucas_11-5" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-jucas-11">[11]</a></sup> A formal truce was signed at <a href="/wiki/Staryi_Chortoryisk" title="Staryi Chortoryisk">Staryi Chortoryisk</a> on 1 September until 24 June 1433.<sup id="cite_ref-cd_15-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-cd-15">[15]</a></sup> The agreement was more favorable to Poland.<sup id="cite_ref-kiaupa_9-8" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-kiaupa-9">[9]</a></sup> The truce did not solve the underlying dispute, however. The war was transformed into a diplomatic struggle, as Poland sought to turn the Lithuanian nobles against Švitrigaila.<sup id="cite_ref-cd_15-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-cd-15">[15]</a></sup>
</p>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Coup_in_Lithuania">Coup in Lithuania</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Lithuanian_Civil_War_(1432%E2%80%931438)&amp;action=edit&amp;section=3" title="Edit section: Coup in Lithuania">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<div class="thumb tleft"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Seal_of_Sigismund_Kestutis.PNG" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/44/Seal_of_Sigismund_Kestutis.PNG/220px-Seal_of_Sigismund_Kestutis.PNG" decoding="async" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/44/Seal_of_Sigismund_Kestutis.PNG/330px-Seal_of_Sigismund_Kestutis.PNG 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/44/Seal_of_Sigismund_Kestutis.PNG/440px-Seal_of_Sigismund_Kestutis.PNG 2x" data-file-width="1149" data-file-height="1149" width="220" height="220"></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Seal_of_Sigismund_Kestutis.PNG" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>Royal seal of Sigismund Kęstutaitis</div></div></div>
<p>In April 1432 at <a href="/wiki/Sieradz" title="Sieradz">Sieradz</a>, the Poles offered to Švitrigaila the same deal as Vytautas had during his reign: Švitrigaila would be the Grand Duke and Jogaila would be the Supreme Duke and after Švitrigaila's death Lithuanian throne would revert to one of Jogaila's sons.<sup id="cite_ref-kiaupa_9-9" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-kiaupa-9">[9]</a></sup> Švitrigaila ostensibly refused the offer crystallizing local resistance.<sup id="cite_ref-frost_16-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-frost-16">[16]</a></sup> On 31 August 1432, conspirators, including <a href="/wiki/Olshanski" title="Olshanski">Semen Olshanski</a>, <a href="/wiki/Petras_Mangirdaitis" class="mw-redirect" title="Petras Mangirdaitis">Petras Mangirdaitis</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Jonas_Go%C5%A1tautas" title="Jonas Goštautas">Jonas Goštautas</a>,<sup id="cite_ref-petra_10-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-petra-10">[10]</a></sup> attacked Švitrigaila and his escort at <a href="/wiki/Ashmyany" title="Ashmyany">Ashmyany</a>, where they were staying the night.<sup id="cite_ref-cd_15-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-cd-15">[15]</a></sup> Švitrigaila and some of his supporters, including <a href="/wiki/Jurgis_Gedgaudas" title="Jurgis Gedgaudas">Jurgis Gedgaudas</a> and <a href="/wiki/Jonas_Manvydas" title="Jonas Manvydas">Jonas Manvydas</a>, managed to escape to <a href="/wiki/Polotsk" title="Polotsk">Polotsk</a> while his pregnant wife was detained.<sup id="cite_ref-frost_16-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-frost-16">[16]</a></sup> The conspirators installed <a href="/wiki/Sigismund_K%C4%99stutaitis" title="Sigismund Kęstutaitis">Sigismund Kęstutaitis</a>, brother of Vytautas, as the new Grand Duke. It is unclear what groups supported Sigismund or why. Possibly some Lithuanian nobles were displeased with favors that Švitrigaila had granted to the Orthodox dukes, but prior to the coup no opposition had manifested itself.<sup id="cite_ref-kiaupa_9-10" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-kiaupa-9">[9]</a></sup> Sigismund, who had not played a major role in Lithuanian politics before the coup,<sup id="cite_ref-kiaupa_9-11" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-kiaupa-9">[9]</a></sup> and who had initially supported Švitrigaila,<sup id="cite_ref-elz_17-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-elz-17">[17]</a></sup> resumed the policy of union with Poland.<sup id="cite_ref-NCMH_12-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-NCMH-12">[12]</a></sup> On 15 October 1432 he signed the <a href="/wiki/Union_of_Grodno_(1432)" title="Union of Grodno (1432)">Union of Grodno</a>, which in essence confirmed the <a href="/wiki/Union_of_Vilnius_and_Radom" class="mw-redirect" title="Union of Vilnius and Radom">Union of Vilnius and Radom</a> (1401) and granted Sigismund the same rights as Vytautas had enjoyed during his reign.<sup id="cite_ref-cd_15-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-cd-15">[15]</a></sup> Following Sigismund's death, Lithuania was to return to the King of Poland. Sigismund also made territorial concessions to Poland in disputed <a href="/wiki/Podolia" title="Podolia">Podolia</a> and <a href="/wiki/Volhynia" title="Volhynia">Volhynia</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-elz_17-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-elz-17">[17]</a></sup>
</p><p>To win support from the nobles, in May 1434 Sigismund granted a <a href="/wiki/Privilege_(legal_ethics)" class="mw-redirect" title="Privilege (legal ethics)">privilege</a> to both Catholic and Orthodox nobles.<sup id="cite_ref-elz_17-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-elz-17">[17]</a></sup> The privilege guaranteed their right to buy, sell, exchange, gift, and inherit land. The <i><a href="/wiki/Veldamas" title="Veldamas">veldamas</a></i>, a class of dependent peasants, were released from taxes and obligations to the state—all their earnings now belonged to the nobles.<sup id="cite_ref-maryte_18-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-maryte-18">[18]</a></sup> No noble was to be punished or imprisoned for crimes without a court order.<sup id="cite_ref-elz_17-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-elz-17">[17]</a></sup> Lithuania divided into two camps: supporters of Sigismund (the Lithuanian lands, <a href="/wiki/Samogitia" title="Samogitia">Samogitia</a>, <a href="/wiki/Trakai_Voivodeship" title="Trakai Voivodeship">Trakai Voivodeship</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Minsk" title="Minsk">Minsk</a>); and supporters of Švitrigaila (<a href="/wiki/Polotsk" title="Polotsk">Polotsk</a>, <a href="/wiki/Vitebsk" title="Vitebsk">Vitebsk</a>, <a href="/wiki/Smolensk" title="Smolensk">Smolensk</a>, <a href="/wiki/Kiev" title="Kiev">Kiev</a>, <a href="/wiki/Volhynia" title="Volhynia">Volhynia</a>).<sup id="cite_ref-kiaupa_9-12" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-kiaupa-9">[9]</a></sup> There began three years of devastating hostilities. On 8 December 1432 the armies of Švitrigaila and Sigismund met in the <a href="/wiki/Battle_of_A%C5%A1mena" class="mw-redirect" title="Battle of Ašmena">Battle of Ašmena</a>. Švitrigaila had enlisted the aid of <a href="/wiki/Sayid_Ahmad_I" title="Sayid Ahmad I">Sayid Ahmad I</a>, Khan of the <a href="/wiki/Golden_Horde" title="Golden Horde">Golden Horde</a>,<sup id="cite_ref-zinkus_19-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-zinkus-19">[19]</a></sup> and wrote to <a href="/wiki/Pope_Eugene_IV" title="Pope Eugene IV">Pope Eugene IV</a> and <a href="/wiki/Council_of_Florence" title="Council of Florence">Council of Florence</a> hoping to gain their support by promising a church union.<sup id="cite_ref-petra_10-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-petra-10">[10]</a></sup> He planned to attack the Grand Duchy's capital, <a href="/wiki/Vilnius" title="Vilnius">Vilnius</a>, and resume the throne.<sup id="cite_ref-zinkus_19-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-zinkus-19">[19]</a></sup> Both sides suffered heavy losses, and final victory went to Sigismund.<sup id="cite_ref-els_13-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-els-13">[13]</a></sup> The Teutonic Order officially observed the truce, but continued its secret support for Švitrigaila, mostly through its Livonian branch.<sup id="cite_ref-u306_6-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-u306-6">[6]</a></sup>
</p>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Hussite_invasion_of_Prussia">Hussite invasion of Prussia</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Lithuanian_Civil_War_(1432%E2%80%931438)&amp;action=edit&amp;section=4" title="Edit section: Hussite invasion of Prussia">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main article: <a href="/wiki/Hussite_Wars" title="Hussite Wars">Hussite Wars</a></div>
<p>In June 1433 Poland allied itself with the <a href="/wiki/Czechs" title="Czechs">Czech</a> <a href="/wiki/Hussite" class="mw-redirect" title="Hussite">Hussites</a> in order to stop the Teutonic Order from sending secret support to Švitrigaila via its <a href="/wiki/Livonian_Order" title="Livonian Order">Livonian branch</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-u306_6-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-u306-6">[6]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Rynarzewski_20-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Rynarzewski-20">[20]</a></sup> The Teutonic Knights had supported the <a href="/wiki/Pope" title="Pope">Pope</a> and <a href="/wiki/Sigismund,_Holy_Roman_Emperor" title="Sigismund, Holy Roman Emperor">Holy Roman Emperor Sigismund</a> against the heretic Hussites during the <a href="/wiki/Hussite_Wars" title="Hussite Wars">Hussite Wars</a>. During their last and largest "<a href="/wiki/Hussite_Wars#Beautiful_rides" title="Hussite Wars">beautiful ride</a>",<sup id="cite_ref-u306_6-4" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-u306-6">[6]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-turnbull15_21-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-turnbull15-21">[21]</a></sup> the Czech forces under <a href="/w/index.php?title=Jan_%C4%8Capek_of_S%C3%A1ny&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Jan Čapek of Sány (page does not exist)">Jan Čapek of Sány</a> were also supported by <a href="/wiki/Pomerania" title="Pomerania">Pomeranian</a> Duke <a href="/wiki/Bogus%C5%82aw_IX" class="mw-redirect" title="Bogusław IX">Bogusław IX</a> of the <a href="/wiki/Pomeranian_duchies_and_dukes#Duchy_of_Stolp_(Słupsk)" class="mw-redirect" title="Pomeranian duchies and dukes">Duchy of Stolp (Słupsk)</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-Proch265_22-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Proch265-22">[22]</a></sup> For four months the Hussite army ravaged Teutonic territories in <a href="/wiki/Neumark" title="Neumark">Neumark</a>, <a href="/wiki/Pomerania" title="Pomerania">Pomerania</a>, and western <a href="/wiki/Prussia_(region)" title="Prussia (region)">Prussia</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-eric_5-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-eric-5">[5]</a></sup> They attacked <a href="/wiki/Chojnice" title="Chojnice">Konitz</a> (now Chojnice), <a href="/wiki/%C5%9Awiecie" title="Świecie">Schwetz</a> (now Świecie) and <a href="/wiki/Gda%C5%84sk" title="Gdańsk">Danzig</a> (now Gdańsk).<sup id="cite_ref-u347_23-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-u347-23">[23]</a></sup> They captured several towns and castles, including <a href="/wiki/Tczew" title="Tczew">Dirschau</a> (now Tczew) on 29 August 1433.<sup id="cite_ref-Rynarzewski_20-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Rynarzewski-20">[20]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-turnbull_24-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-turnbull-24">[24]</a></sup> Despite their failed siege of Danzig, the Hussites celebrated their "beautiful ride" by symbolically filling their bottles with water from the <a href="/wiki/Baltic_Sea" title="Baltic Sea">Baltic Sea</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-turnbull_24-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-turnbull-24">[24]</a></sup>
</p><p>On 13 September 1433 a truce was signed at <a href="/wiki/Jasiniec" title="Jasiniec">Jasiniec</a>. Polish–Teutonic negotiations continued at <a href="/wiki/Brze%C5%9B%C4%87_Kujawski" title="Brześć Kujawski">Brześć Kujawski</a>, and Hussite–Catholic negotiations continued at the <a href="/wiki/Council_of_Florence" title="Council of Florence">Council of Florence</a> and at the Czech Diet in <a href="/wiki/Prague" title="Prague">Prague</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-u347_23-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-u347-23">[23]</a></sup> The Polish-led invasion of Neumark and Pomerania had proven successful, cutting the Teutonic Order off from support from the Holy Roman Empire, and convincing the Order to sign a treaty with the Poles.<sup id="cite_ref-Rynarzewski_20-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Rynarzewski-20">[20]</a></sup> On 15 December 1433, twelve-year <a href="/wiki/Truce_of_%C5%81%C4%99czyca" title="Truce of Łęczyca">Truce of Łęczyca</a> was signed between the Poles and the Order at <a href="/wiki/%C5%81%C4%99czyca" title="Łęczyca">Łęczyca</a><sup id="cite_ref-Rynarzewski_20-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Rynarzewski-20">[20]</a></sup> (leading some Polish historians to divide this Polish–Teutonic War into two wars: in 1431–1433; and in 1435).<sup id="cite_ref-gier_25-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-gier-25">[25]</a></sup> The Teutonic Knights agreed to most of the Polish demands, including that the Order cease its support for Švitrigaila, each side would control the territories that it occupied until a peace was signed (<i>uti possidetis</i>), and no party would seek mediation by foreign powers in order to alter this truce.<sup id="cite_ref-Kon_26-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Kon-26">[26]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Rogalski_27-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Rogalski-27">[27]</a></sup> This marked the end of the war on Polish soil; the struggle on Lithuanian lands would continue for two more years,<sup id="cite_ref-WIEM_28-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-WIEM-28">[28]</a></sup> as the truce with Poland did not extend to the <a href="/wiki/Livonian_Order" title="Livonian Order">Livonian Order</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-Kon_26-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Kon-26">[26]</a></sup>
</p>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Decisive_battle">Decisive battle</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Lithuanian_Civil_War_(1432%E2%80%931438)&amp;action=edit&amp;section=5" title="Edit section: Decisive battle">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main article: <a href="/wiki/Battle_of_Pabaiskas" class="mw-redirect" title="Battle of Pabaiskas">Battle of Pabaiskas</a></div>
<p>In July and August 1433, Švitrigaila and his Livonian allies raided <a href="/wiki/Lida" title="Lida">Lida</a>, <a href="/wiki/Kreva" title="Kreva">Kreva</a> and <a href="/wiki/Ei%C5%A1i%C5%A1k%C4%97s" title="Eišiškės">Eišiškės</a> and devastated the suburbs of <a href="/wiki/Vilnius" title="Vilnius">Vilnius</a>, <a href="/wiki/Trakai" title="Trakai">Trakai</a> and <a href="/wiki/Kaunas" title="Kaunas">Kaunas</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-els_13-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-els-13">[13]</a></sup> The hostilities were briefly stopped by horse plague.<sup id="cite_ref-els_13-4" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-els-13">[13]</a></sup> When Jogaila died in May 1434, the Order resumed its backing for Švitrigaila,<sup id="cite_ref-u311_29-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-u311-29">[29]</a></sup> who rallied his supporters, including knights from the Livonian Order, the Orthodox dukes, and his nephew <a href="/wiki/Sigismund_Korybut" title="Sigismund Korybut">Sigismund Korybut</a>, a distinguished military commander of the Hussites.<sup id="cite_ref-piro_30-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-piro-30">[30]</a></sup> In July 1435, Švitrigaila foiled a coup against him in <a href="/wiki/Smolensk" title="Smolensk">Smolensk</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-petra_10-4" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-petra-10">[10]</a></sup> Coup leader Orthodox bishop <a href="/w/index.php?title=Gerasim,_Metropolitan_of_Moscow&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Gerasim, Metropolitan of Moscow (page does not exist)">Gerasim</a>, consecrated as <a href="/wiki/Metropolitan_of_Moscow" class="mw-redirect" title="Metropolitan of Moscow">Metropolitan of Moscow</a> in 1432, was <a href="/wiki/Death_by_burning" title="Death by burning">burned at the stake</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-curtin_31-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-curtin-31">[31]</a></sup> The final battle, at <a href="/wiki/Battle_of_Pabaiskas" class="mw-redirect" title="Battle of Pabaiskas">Pabaiskas</a>, was fought in September 1435 near <a href="/wiki/Ukmerg%C4%97" title="Ukmergė">Ukmergė</a> (Vilkomir, Wiłkomierz), northwest of Vilnius. It is estimated to have involved 30,000 men on both sides.<sup id="cite_ref-el_32-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-el-32">[32]</a></sup> Švitrigaila's army, led by Sigismund Korybut, was split by the attacking Lithuanian–Polish army, led by <a href="/wiki/Michael_%C5%BDygimantaitis" title="Michael Žygimantaitis">Michael Žygimantaitis</a>, and soundly defeated.<sup id="cite_ref-el_32-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-el-32">[32]</a></sup>
</p><p>Švitrigaila, with a small group of followers, managed to escape to <a href="/wiki/Polotsk" title="Polotsk">Polotsk</a>. The <a href="/wiki/Livonian_Order" title="Livonian Order">Livonian Order</a> had suffered a great defeat, sometimes compared to that which had been inflicted on the Teutonic Knights at <a href="/wiki/Battle_of_Grunwald" title="Battle of Grunwald">Grunwald</a> in 1410.<sup id="cite_ref-u311_29-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-u311-29">[29]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-el_32-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-el-32">[32]</a></sup> On 31 December 1435 the Teutonic Knights signed a <a href="/wiki/Peace_of_Brze%C5%9B%C4%87_Kujawski" title="Peace of Brześć Kujawski">peace treaty at Brześć Kujawski</a>. They agreed to cease their support for Švitrigaila, and in the future to support only Grand Dukes who had been properly elected jointly by Poland and Lithuania. The treaty did not change the borders that had been set by the <a href="/wiki/Treaty_of_Melno" title="Treaty of Melno">Treaty of Melno</a> in 1422.<sup id="cite_ref-kamun_33-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-kamun-33">[33]</a></sup> The Peace of Brześć Kujawski showed that the Teutonic Knights had lost their universal missionary status.<sup id="cite_ref-kiaupa_9-13" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-kiaupa-9">[9]</a></sup> The Teutonic and Livonian Orders no longer interfered in Polish–Lithuanian affairs; instead, Poland and Lithuania would involve themselves in the <a href="/wiki/Thirteen_Years%27_War_(1454%E2%80%9366)" class="mw-redirect" title="Thirteen Years' War (1454–66)">Thirteen Years' War (1454–66)</a>, the civil war that would tear Prussia in half.<sup id="cite_ref-eric_5-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-eric-5">[5]</a></sup>
</p>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Aftermath">Aftermath</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Lithuanian_Civil_War_(1432%E2%80%931438)&amp;action=edit&amp;section=6" title="Edit section: Aftermath">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<p>Švitrigaila was losing his influence in the Slavic principalities and could no longer resist Poland and Sigismund. On 4 September 1437 he attempted to reconcile with Poland: he would rule the lands that still backed him (chiefly <a href="/wiki/Kiev" title="Kiev">Kiev</a> and <a href="/wiki/Volhynia" title="Volhynia">Volhynia</a>), and after his death these territories would pass to the King of Poland.<sup id="cite_ref-dundu_34-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-dundu-34">[34]</a></sup> However, under strong protest from Sigismund, the Polish Senate declined to ratify the treaty .<sup id="cite_ref-els_13-5" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-els-13">[13]</a></sup> In 1438 Švitrigaila withdrew to Moldavia.<sup id="cite_ref-u313_35-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-u313-35">[35]</a></sup> The reign of Sigismund Kęstutaitis was brief — he was assassinated in 1440. Švitrigaila returned from exile in 1442 and ruled <a href="/wiki/Lutsk" title="Lutsk">Lutsk</a> until his death a decade later.<sup id="cite_ref-els_13-6" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-els-13">[13]</a></sup>
</p><p>Jogaila's son <a href="/wiki/Casimir_IV_Jagiellon" title="Casimir IV Jagiellon">Casimir IV Jagiellon</a>, born in 1426, received approval as a hereditary <i><a href="/wiki/Hospodar" title="Hospodar">hospodar</a></i> from Lithuania's ruling families in 1440.<sup id="cite_ref-concise_36-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-concise-36">[36]</a></sup> This event is seen by the historians <a href="/wiki/Jerzy_Lukowski" title="Jerzy Lukowski">Jerzy Lukowski</a> and <a href="/w/index.php?title=Hubert_Zawadzki&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Hubert Zawadzki (page does not exist)">Hubert Zawadzki</a> as marking the end of the succession dispute.<sup id="cite_ref-concise_36-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-concise-36">[36]</a></sup>
</p>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="See_also">See also</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Lithuanian_Civil_War_(1432%E2%80%931438)&amp;action=edit&amp;section=7" title="Edit section: See also">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<ul><li><a href="/wiki/Galicia%E2%80%93Volhynia_Wars" title="Galicia–Volhynia Wars">Galicia–Volhynia Wars</a></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Polish-Lithuanian_identity" title="Polish-Lithuanian identity">Polish-Lithuanian identity</a></li></ul>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="References">References</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Lithuanian_Civil_War_(1432%E2%80%931438)&amp;action=edit&amp;section=8" title="Edit section: References">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<div class="reflist columns references-column-width" style="-moz-column-width: 30em; -webkit-column-width: 30em; column-width: 30em; list-style-type: decimal;">
<ol class="references">
<li id="cite_note-polekh-1"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-polekh_1-0" aria-label="Jump up" title="Jump up">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite id="CITEREFPolekhov2015" class="citation book">Polekhov, Sergey V. (2015).  <bdi lang="ru">Наследники Витовта. Династическая война в Великом княжестве Литовском в 30-е годы XV века</bdi> [<i>Vytautas' Successors. </li>
<li id="cite_note-rowell-2"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-rowell_2-0"><span class="cite-accessibility-label">Jump up to: </span><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-rowell_2-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite id="CITEREFRowell1994" class="citation book">Rowell, S. C. (1994). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=i4hpVJ51y4oC&amp;pg=PA69&amp;"><i>Lithuania ascending: a pagan empire within east-central Europe, 1295-1345</i></a>. <a href="/wiki/Cambridge_University_Press" title="Cambridge University Press">Cambridge University Press</a>. p.&nbsp;69. <q>On the civil war in Lithuania between Švitrigaila and Jogaila Algirdaičiai and Žygimantas Kestutaitis which almost destroyed the union of Lithuania with Poland, see...</q></cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Lithuania+ascending%3A+a+pagan+empire+within+east-central+Europe%2C+1295-1345&amp;rft.pages=69&amp;rft.pub=Cambridge+University+Press&amp;rft.date=1994&amp;rft.aulast=Rowell&amp;rft.aufirst=S.+C.&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3Di4hpVJ51y4oC%26pg%3DPA69%26&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ALithuanian+Civil+War+%281432%E2%80%931438%29" class="Z3988"></span><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r951705291"></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-vauch-3"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-vauch_3-0" aria-label="Jump up" title="Jump up">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite id="CITEREFVauchezDobsonLapidge2000" class="citation book">Vauchez, André; Dobson, Richard Barrie; Lapidge, Michael (2000). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=qtgotOF0MKQC&amp;pg=PA163&amp;"><i>Encyclopedia of the Middle Ages, Volume 1</i></a>. <a href="/wiki/Routledge" title="Routledge">Routledge</a>. p.&nbsp;163. <q>After the death in 1430 of Vitold (Vytautas), who had governed the Grand Duchy under the nominal sovereignty of Jagiello, discrimination against the Ruthenians led to a civil war.</q></cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Encyclopedia+of+the+Middle+Ages%2C+Volume+1&amp;rft.pages=163&amp;rft.pub=Routledge&amp;rft.date=2000&amp;rft.aulast=Vauchez&amp;rft.aufirst=Andr%C3%A9&amp;rft.au=Dobson%2C+Richard+Barrie&amp;rft.au=Lapidge%2C+Michael&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3DqtgotOF0MKQC%26pg%3DPA163%26&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ALithuanian+Civil+War+%281432%E2%80%931438%29" class="Z3988"></span><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r951705291"></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-green-4"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-green_4-0" aria-label="Jump up" title="Jump up">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite id="CITEREFGreenbaum1995" class="citation book">Greenbaum, Masha (1995). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=E2_ag8xGWMQC&amp;pg=PA10"><i>The Jews of Lithuania: a history of a remarkable community, 1316-1945</i></a>. <a href="/wiki/Gefen_Publishing_House" title="Gefen Publishing House">Gefen Publishing House</a>. p.&nbsp;10. <q>One year before his death in 1430, Vytautas reconfirmed the union with Poland. His death triggered a civil war...</q></cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=The+Jews+of+Lithuania%3A+a+history+of+a+remarkable+community%2C+1316-1945&amp;rft.pages=10&amp;rft.pub=Gefen+Publishing+House&amp;rft.date=1995&amp;rft.aulast=Greenbaum&amp;rft.aufirst=Masha&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3DE2_ag8xGWMQC%26pg%3DPA10&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ALithuanian+Civil+War+%281432%E2%80%931438%29" class="Z3988"></span><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r951705291"></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-eric-5"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-eric_5-0"><span class="cite-accessibility-label">Jump up to: </span><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-eric_5-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-eric_5-2"><sup><i><b>c</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite id="CITEREFChristiansen1997" class="citation book">Christiansen, Eric (1997). <span class="cs1-lock-registration" title="Free registration required"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://archive.org/details/northerncrusades00eric/page/242"><i>The Northern Crusades</i></a></span>. London: Penguin Books. pp.&nbsp;<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://archive.org/details/northerncrusades00eric/page/242">242–243</a>. <a href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a>&nbsp;<a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/0-14-026653-4" title="Special:BookSources/0-14-026653-4"><bdi>0-14-026653-4</bdi></a>.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=The+Northern+Crusades&amp;rft.place=London&amp;rft.pages=242-243&amp;rft.pub=Penguin+Books&amp;rft.date=1997&amp;rft.isbn=0-14-026653-4&amp;rft.aulast=Christiansen&amp;rft.aufirst=Eric&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Farchive.org%2Fdetails%2Fnortherncrusades00eric%2Fpage%2F242&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ALithuanian+Civil+War+%281432%E2%80%931438%29" class="Z3988"></span><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r951705291"></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-u306-6"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-u306_6-0"><span class="cite-accessibility-label">Jump up to: </span><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-u306_6-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-u306_6-2"><sup><i><b>c</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-u306_6-3"><sup><i><b>d</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-u306_6-4"><sup><i><b>e</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite id="CITEREFUrban2003" class="citation book">Urban, William (2003). <i>Tannenberg and After</i>. Chicago: <a href="/wiki/Lithuanian_Research_and_Studies_Center" title="Lithuanian Research and Studies Center">Lithuanian Research and Studies Center</a>. pp.&nbsp;306–308. <a href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a>&nbsp;<a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/0-929700-25-2" title="Special:BookSources/0-929700-25-2"><bdi>0-929700-25-2</bdi></a>.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Tannenberg+and+After&amp;rft.place=Chicago&amp;rft.pages=306-308&amp;rft.pub=Lithuanian+Research+and+Studies+Center&amp;rft.date=2003&amp;rft.isbn=0-929700-25-2&amp;rft.aulast=Urban&amp;rft.aufirst=William&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ALithuanian+Civil+War+%281432%E2%80%931438%29" class="Z3988"></span><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r951705291"></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-france-7"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-france_7-0" aria-label="Jump up" title="Jump up">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite id="CITEREFFrance2005" class="citation book">France, John (2005). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=uNMeHnVOevkC&amp;pg=PA265"><i>The Crusades and the expansion of Catholic Christendom, 1000-1714</i></a>. <a href="/wiki/Routledge" title="Routledge">Routledge</a>. p.&nbsp;265. <a href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a>&nbsp;<a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-415-37128-5" title="Special:BookSources/978-0-415-37128-5"><bdi>978-0-415-37128-5</bdi></a>. <q>The costs of these troops and the nagging wars with Poland, which ended indecisively in 1435, bore heavily upon the cities, merchants, and knightly settlers in Prussia, with the result that the Grand Master found ever more resistance to his central and despotic control.</q></cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=The+Crusades+and+the+expansion+of+Catholic+Christendom%2C+1000-1714&amp;rft.pages=265&amp;rft.pub=Routledge&amp;rft.date=2005&amp;rft.isbn=978-0-415-37128-5&amp;rft.aulast=France&amp;rft.aufirst=John&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3DuNMeHnVOevkC%26pg%3DPA265&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ALithuanian+Civil+War+%281432%E2%80%931438%29" class="Z3988"></span><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r951705291"></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-koncius-8"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-koncius_8-0" aria-label="Jump up" title="Jump up">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite id="CITEREFKoncius1964" class="citation book">Koncius, Joseph B. Miami: Franklin Press. pp.&nbsp;182–184. <a href="/wiki/LCC_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="LCC (identifier)">LCC</a>&nbsp;<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://catalog.loc.gov/vwebv/search?searchCode=CALL%2B&amp;searchArg=66089704&amp;searchType=1&amp;recCount=25">66089704</a>.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Vytautas+the+Great%2C+Grand+Duke+of+Lithuania&amp;rft.place=Miami&amp;rft.pages=182-184&amp;rft.pub=Franklin+Press&amp;rft.date=1964&amp;rft.aulast=Koncius&amp;rft.aufirst=Joseph+B.&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ALithuanian+Civil+War+%281432%E2%80%931438%29" class="Z3988"></span><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r951705291"></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-kiaupa-9"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-kiaupa_9-0"><span class="cite-accessibility-label">Jump up to: </span><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-kiaupa_9-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-kiaupa_9-2"><sup><i><b>c</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-kiaupa_9-3"><sup><i><b>d</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-kiaupa_9-4"><sup><i><b>e</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-kiaupa_9-5"><sup><i><b>f</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-kiaupa_9-6"><sup><i><b>g</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-kiaupa_9-7"><sup><i><b>h</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-kiaupa_9-8"><sup><i><b>i</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-kiaupa_9-9"><sup><i><b>j</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-kiaupa_9-10"><sup><i><b>k</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-kiaupa_9-11"><sup><i><b>l</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-kiaupa_9-12"><sup><i><b>m</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-kiaupa_9-13"><sup><i><b>n</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite id="CITEREFKiaupaKiaupienėKunevičius2000" class="citation book">Kiaupa, Zigmantas; Kiaupienė, Jūratė; Kunevičius, Albinas (2000) [1995]. <i>The History of Lithuania Before 1795</i> (English ed.). Vilnius: Lithuanian Institute of History. pp.&nbsp;205–211. <a href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a>&nbsp;<a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/9986-810-13-2" title="Special:BookSources/9986-810-13-2"><bdi>9986-810-13-2</bdi></a>.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=The+History+of+Lithuania+Before+1795&amp;rft.place=Vilnius&amp;rft.pages=205-211&amp;rft.edition=English&amp;rft.pub=Lithuanian+Institute+of+History&amp;rft.date=2000&amp;rft.isbn=9986-810-13-2&amp;rft.aulast=Kiaupa&amp;rft.aufirst=Zigmantas&amp;rft.au=Kiaupien%C4%97%2C+J%C5%ABrat%C4%97&amp;rft.au=Kunevi%C4%8Dius%2C+Albinas&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ALithuanian+Civil+War+%281432%E2%80%931438%29" class="Z3988"></span><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r951705291"></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-petra-10"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-petra_10-0"><span class="cite-accessibility-label">Jump up to: </span><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-petra_10-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-petra_10-2"><sup><i><b>c</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-petra_10-3"><sup><i><b>d</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-petra_10-4"><sup><i><b>e</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite id="CITEREFPetrauskasKiaupienė2009" class="citation book">Petrauskas, Rimvydas; Kiaupienė, Jūratė (2009). <i><a href="/wiki/History_of_Lithuania_(book)" title="History of Lithuania (book)">Lietuvos istorija</a>. </li>
<li id="cite_note-jucas-11"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-jucas_11-0"><span class="cite-accessibility-label">Jump up to: </span><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-jucas_11-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-jucas_11-2"><sup><i><b>c</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-jucas_11-3"><sup><i><b>d</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-jucas_11-4"><sup><i><b>e</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-jucas_11-5"><sup><i><b>f</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite id="CITEREFJučas2000" class="citation book">Jučas, Mečislovas (2000). <i>Lietuvos ir Lenkijos unija</i> (in Lithuanian). </li>
<li id="cite_note-NCMH-12"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-NCMH_12-0"><span class="cite-accessibility-label">Jump up to: </span><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-NCMH_12-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-NCMH_12-2"><sup><i><b>c</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite id="CITEREFGieysztor1998" class="citation book"><a href="/wiki/Aleksander_Gieysztor" title="Aleksander Gieysztor">Gieysztor, Aleksander</a> (1998). "The kingdom of Poland and the grand duchy of Lithuania, 1370–1506". <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=Qzc8OeuSXFMC&amp;pg=RA2-PA732"><i>The New Cambridge Medieval History, c.1415–c.1500</i></a>. <b>7</b>. Cambridge University Press. pp.&nbsp;734–735. <a href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a>&nbsp;<a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/0-521-38296-3" title="Special:BookSources/0-521-38296-3"><bdi>0-521-38296-3</bdi></a>.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=bookitem&amp;rft.atitle=The+kingdom+of+Poland+and+the+grand+duchy+of+Lithuania%2C+1370%E2%80%931506&amp;rft.btitle=The+New+Cambridge+Medieval+History%2C+c.1415%E2%80%93c.1500&amp;rft.pages=734-735&amp;rft.pub=Cambridge+University+Press&amp;rft.date=1998&amp;rft.isbn=0-521-38296-3&amp;rft.aulast=Gieysztor&amp;rft.aufirst=Aleksander&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3DQzc8OeuSXFMC%26pg%3DRA2-PA732&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ALithuanian+Civil+War+%281432%E2%80%931438%29" class="Z3988"></span><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r951705291"></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-els-13"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-els_13-0"><span class="cite-accessibility-label">Jump up to: </span><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-els_13-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-els_13-2"><sup><i><b>c</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-els_13-3"><sup><i><b>d</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-els_13-4"><sup><i><b>e</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-els_13-5"><sup><i><b>f</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-els_13-6"><sup><i><b>g</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite id="CITEREFSužiedėlis1970–1978" class="citation encyclopaedia">Sužiedėlis, Simas, ed. (1970–1978). "Švitrigaila". <i><a href="/wiki/Encyclopedia_Lituanica" title="Encyclopedia Lituanica">Encyclopedia Lituanica</a></i>. <b>V</b>. Boston, Massachusetts: Juozas Kapočius. pp.&nbsp;348–350. <a href="/wiki/LCC_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="LCC (identifier)">LCC</a>&nbsp;<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://catalog.loc.gov/vwebv/search?searchCode=CALL%2B&amp;searchArg=74-114275&amp;searchType=1&amp;recCount=25">74-114275</a>.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=bookitem&amp;rft.atitle=%C5%A0vitrigaila&amp;rft.btitle=Encyclopedia+Lituanica&amp;rft.place=Boston%2C+Massachusetts&amp;rft.pages=348-350&amp;rft.pub=Juozas+Kapo%C4%8Dius&amp;rft.date=1970%2F1978&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ALithuanian+Civil+War+%281432%E2%80%931438%29" class="Z3988"></span><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r951705291"></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-biskup-14"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-biskup_14-0" aria-label="Jump up" title="Jump up">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite id="CITEREFBiskup1967" class="citation journal">Biskup, Marian (1967). "Najazd krzyżacki na Polskę i bitwa pod Dąbkami 1431". <i>Zeszyty Naukowe Wojskowej Akademii Politycznej</i> (in Polish). Historia (15).</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Zeszyty+Naukowe+Wojskowej+Akademii+Politycznej&amp;rft.atitle=Najazd+krzy%C5%BCacki+na+Polsk%C4%99+i+bitwa+pod+D%C4%85bkami+1431&amp;rft.volume=Historia&amp;rft.issue=15&amp;rft.date=1967&amp;rft.aulast=Biskup&amp;rft.aufirst=Marian&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ALithuanian+Civil+War+%281432%E2%80%931438%29" class="Z3988"></span><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r951705291"></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-cd-15"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-cd_15-0"><span class="cite-accessibility-label">Jump up to: </span><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-cd_15-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-cd_15-2"><sup><i><b>c</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-cd_15-3"><sup><i><b>d</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite id="CITEREFKiaupienė2002" class="citation book">Kiaupienė, Jūratė (2002). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20080303191252/http://mkp.emokykla.lt/gimtoji/">"Gediminaičiai ir Jogailaičiai prie Vytauto palikimo"</a>. <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://mkp.emokykla.lt/gimtoji/"><i>Gimtoji istorija. Nuo 7 iki 12 klasės</i></a> (in Lithuanian). Vilnius: Elektroninės leidybos namai. <a href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a>&nbsp;<a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/9986-9216-9-4" title="Special:BookSources/9986-9216-9-4"><bdi>9986-9216-9-4</bdi></a>. Archived from <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://mkp.emokykla.lt/gimtoji/?id=848">the original</a> on 2008-03-03<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">2008-07-02</span></span>.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=bookitem&amp;rft.atitle=Gediminai%C4%8Diai+ir+Jogailai%C4%8Diai+prie+Vytauto+palikimo&amp;rft.btitle=Gimtoji+istorija.+Nuo+7+iki+12+klas%C4%97s&amp;rft.place=Vilnius&amp;rft.pub=Elektronin%C4%97s+leidybos+namai&amp;rft.date=2002&amp;rft.isbn=9986-9216-9-4&amp;rft.aulast=Kiaupien%C4%97&amp;rft.aufirst=J%C5%ABrat%C4%97&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fmkp.emokykla.lt%2Fgimtoji%2F%3Fid%3D848&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ALithuanian+Civil+War+%281432%E2%80%931438%29" class="Z3988"></span><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r951705291"></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-frost-16"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-frost_16-0"><span class="cite-accessibility-label">Jump up to: </span><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-frost_16-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite id="CITEREFFrost2015" class="citation book">Frost, Robert (2015). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=gc0kCQAAQBAJ&amp;pg=PA170"><i>The Making of the Polish-Lithuanian Union 1385-1569</i></a>. Oxford History of Early Modern Europe. <b>I</b>. Oxford University Press. p.&nbsp;170. <a href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a>&nbsp;<a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/9780191017872" title="Special:BookSources/9780191017872"><bdi>9780191017872</bdi></a>.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=The+Making+of+the+Polish-Lithuanian+Union+1385-1569&amp;rft.series=Oxford+History+of+Early+Modern+Europe&amp;rft.pages=170&amp;rft.pub=Oxford+University+Press&amp;rft.date=2015&amp;rft.isbn=9780191017872&amp;rft.aulast=Frost&amp;rft.aufirst=Robert&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3Dgc0kCQAAQBAJ%26pg%3DPA170&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ALithuanian+Civil+War+%281432%E2%80%931438%29" class="Z3988"></span><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r951705291"></span>

<li id="cite_note-elz-17"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-elz_17-0"><span class="cite-accessibility-label">Jump up to: </span><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-elz_17-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-elz_17-2"><sup><i><b>c</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-elz_17-3"><sup><i><b>d</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite id="CITEREFSužiedėlis1970–1978" class="citation encyclopaedia">Sužiedėlis, Simas, ed. </li>
<li id="cite_note-maryte-18"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-maryte_18-0" aria-label="Jump up" title="Jump up">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite id="CITEREFTarvydienė2007" class="citation book">Tarvydienė, Marytė Elena (2007). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20110722151716/http://www.lzuu.lt/file.doc?id=17317"><i>Žemėtvarkos pagrindai</i></a> (in Lithuanian). <a href="/wiki/Lithuanian_University_of_Agriculture" class="mw-redirect" title="Lithuanian University of Agriculture">Lithuanian University of Agriculture</a>. pp.&nbsp;22–24. <li id="cite_note-Rynarzewski-20"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-Rynarzewski_20-0"><span class="cite-accessibility-label">Jump up to: </span><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-Rynarzewski_20-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-Rynarzewski_20-2"><sup><i><b>c</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-Rynarzewski_20-3"><sup><i><b>d</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite id="CITEREFRynarzewski" class="citation web">Rynarzewski, Maciej. <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20090306101544/http://www.pth.olsztyn.pl/abstrakty/Maciej%20Rynarzewski%20Abstract.pdf">"Polish – Bohemian expedition to Nowa Marchia and Pomorze Gdańskie in year 1433"</a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span>. <li id="cite_note-u347-23"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-u347_23-0"><span class="cite-accessibility-label">Jump up to: </span><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-u347_23-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite id="CITEREFUrban2003" class="citation book">Urban, William (2003). <i>Tannenberg and After</i>. </li>
<li id="cite_note-turnbull-24"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-turnbull_24-0"><span class="cite-accessibility-label">Jump up to: </span><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-turnbull_24-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite id="CITEREFTurnbull2003" class="citation book"><a href="/wiki/Stephen_Turnbull_(historian)" title="Stephen Turnbull (historian)">Turnbull, Stephen</a> (2003). <i>Tannenberg 1410: Disaster for the Teutonic Knights</i>. </li>
<li id="cite_note-gier-25"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-gier_25-0" aria-label="Jump up" title="Jump up">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite id="CITEREFGiertychCarroll1958" class="citation book">Giertych, Jędrzej; Carroll, Brazilla (1958). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=tg4gAAAAMAAJ&amp;pgis=1"><i>Poland and Germany: A Reply to Congressman B.
